instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> USB-C not working
threads.message:
Hello, i have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with initial had charging issues, found short <CAPACITOR>C7131</CAPACITOR>, replaced and device turns on now.
Charging still have some issues where only 1 side is able to charge. i replaced <CHIP>U4520</CHIP> and now it works both side (actually i tested with chip removed and that works so no idea how <CHIP>U4520</CHIP> prevented charging on 1 side)

now i have new issues, my USB-C is not getting power from the board so accessories don't work. i replaced <CHIP>U4400</CHIP> and now it works on 1 side, still doesn't work on the other side. the thing is i don't know which usb pair is working, E85 N/P pair or USB Extra N/P pair. if replacing <CHIP>U4400</CHIP> works my guess is USB extra pair works, which IC controls the other pair?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> USB-C not working
threads.message:
CC1/2 lines detect and configure the charger.

Did you try another USB-C flex/connector?
Remove and inspect connector pins.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> USB-C not working
threads.message: replaced the pin and still the same. measured using a usb C breakout board and diode readings are good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> USB-C not working
threads.message: so where should i check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> USB-C not working
threads.message: update. i manage to fix this. So keypoint is that it USB C works 1 side and not the other. <CHIP>U7860</CHIP> was the culprit. for the others if USB not detected, check <CHIP>U4520</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4400</CHIP>. <CHIP>U7860</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7865</CHIP> for the flip side.
